intro: Henckelia pyroliflora, commonly known as the flame flower, is a striking plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its vibrant orange-red flowers, which are borne in clusters and attract a variety of pollinators. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. Henckelia pyroliflora thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to flourish.
